annotation.TEXT: Double kill!
Will the next level be Chocolate Island 5, perhaps?
I wonder what I missed to the left...
To be continued...
Oh, and I gotta remember that I can't cape spin parakoopas.
D'oh!!! Well, maybe I can reach the flower from the platforms on the right.
Nuts, it despawned already. Oh, well...
Hello, and welcome back to the present! Let's see what the beginning of world 7 has to offer us. Will it be Valley of Bowser 1 or 2?
I just barely made that jump. Hey, are these things flammable, inflammable, or non-flammable? Non-flammable it appears.
What the? I can knock the springboard around with my cape? Hahaha... And I even get 200 points per hit as well!
And, actually, since I can't glide with the cape and can't cape spin parakoopas, I think the flower is the better choice for this part!
Oh, maybe because it's a bonus room entrance as well? (That didn't stop a pipe in Donut Plains 1 from being both an entrance and an exit.)
Eh, I got two. Now, I'm not going to get ambushed on exit, right?
Hmm... Maybe I should hit some of these blocks to remove their sprites and reduce lag.
Ooh, I'd better be real careful with this jump.
Oh, really? The timed platforms are here?
Okay, I'd better be careful not to accidentally... Oops!
Okay, that worked. Now let's burninate some parakoopas!
Aw, that sucks. You can't kill fuzzies with star power.
Hmm... I don't think I checked to see if this brown block had an item. Oh, well... Whatever it could've been wouldn't have been that important.
Okay, springboard's back. Now, let's not knock it into the abyss by accident again!
Whoa!
And we have the four-second version as well!
Huh. I don't think I've ever seen the two dummies adjacent to each other at the same time in the SNES version before (or the boss adjacent to either dummy).
No, I guess it was a regular mushroom. Oh, but at least it didn't overwrite my reserve flower!
Yeah, screw this! I'm going back through that bonus room once again to make the flower respawn, and I'm going to use that against them!
I guess not. The goal trigger stretches all the way down here. Oh, but at least I don't get Kaizo trapped, unlike in the original game!
Argh!!! The hitboxes on these things suck!
What the? Why is there a brown used block where a ? block with a feather should be?
Wow, I seriously let that guy hit me?! Okay, I'm really sorry folks, but I'm going to go through that bonus room yet again!
Actually, forget it. Too risky.
Whoa! An attempted jump failed there! Good thing there was a platform below for me to land on!
Okay, so I can certainly be knocked off of Yoshi by Wendy or her dummies...
I can't eat any of them though, nor can I eat the fireball (which has glitched graphics now, but my reserve item doesn't!), but the fireball can't hurt Yoshi!
This doesn't look like a Valley of Bowser level. It looks like Chocolate Island 3, actually. (I should've expected that.)
Okay, I tried to burn that guy off screen, missed, but at least wasn't injured myself (probably due to the game not letting my hitbox go higher than a certain point up there).

Now, as there have been exactly four levels per world so far (not counting Yoshi's Houses), I wonder if this ghost house and that Bowser head are the final two levels in the game? Find out next time, on quite possibly the finale of Super Mario World NES!
Wow, what is this, like five times I've gone through this bonus room now?
Well, there's the goal, but could the secret exit possibly be here as well?
Finally! I've gotten rid of all of those parakoopas without losing a power up!
Hello, and welcome back to Chocolate Fortress! I decided to go back in time a bit to see what can happen if I make it to a boss room with Yoshi. He can enter the boss door while I'm super, right?
No, it's Valley of Bowser 3! Well, that's interesting. Does it include those timed platforms?

That's interesting, though, how most of those aspects work the opposite way in the SNES version, where Yoshi can eat the fireball, the dummies, and the boss, but the fireball would hurt Yoshi as well.

They appear to work properly, too! Although, they drop straight down real fast the instant they expire. I'd better watch out for that. (Also, yay! More collectable coins, so I'm not stuck at 99 anymore!)
What? Another brown block where a power up should be? Oh, but this one does have an item-- A star! That seems kind of odd...
By the way, you can't burn the springboard, right? Just checking.
Oh, yeah. Banzai Bills get replaced with triple flames. I'd better watch out for that.
No bonus room there. Also, was I just spazzing out again?
Alright, well that's it for the boss revisit, so let's go back to the future, where I left off at the end of the previous episode.
Yep, which is more than can be said of the SNES version. (Why were the SNES version's doors programmed so oddly when it comes to Yoshi?)
Still no bonus game. It's too bad that the side area with the tons of coins isn't present. (Speaking of coins, I've been at exactly 99 coins for how long now?)
Also, it appears that there's a glitch in their movement. They're gradually inching further and further to the left, away from the block they start on.
Huh. So if you hold up while standing on a corner, Mario spazzes out like that. I wonder why... Does Mario's hitbox change while he's looking up?
Hmm... Actually, maybe I should take that flower...
Well, maybe I can make it respawn by going through the bonus room again.
Oh, what's this? The map music has changed to the invincibility music, which is actually the Valley of Bowser music! We must be nearing the end!
I'd say "good thing the star expired right there", but I've noticed that I can still "stomp" things normally while invincible, so I'm sure I would've bounced off the parakoopas anyway.

Yeah, there are a few minor convenient things like that that this game does that the original didn't do. Well, this level's done now, and I'm surprised I didn't fall to my death somewhere along the way!
I don't know why I tried the upper pipe first, since the lower pipe has the bonus room in the original!
Wait, shouldn't that be a 1-up mushroom and not a regular mushroom? Or is it a palette issue?
And of course, revisits in the same run won't give me anything.
Also, I think my springboard got jammed in the slope there. With all my running around there, I wasn't picking it up or even bouncing off of it.
LOL, shell fell through the floor.
Huh. I don't remember a pipe being there in the original. Why didn't I just come out of the pipe just to the left?
So I guess I'm going to have to deal with lots of these rotating platforms. Shouldn't be too hard... maybe...
Whoa, that was actually risky. What if that platform wasn't treated as solid while it was below the screen? But, fortunately, it was.
